remarks: The value of the value of a curried operation given in maps-to notation is the operation value of the original operation.  (Contributed by AV, 27-Oct-2019.)
statement:
fvmpt2curryd.f $e |- F = ( x e. X , y e. Y |-> C ) $.
fvmpt2curryd.c $e |- ( ph -> A. x e. X A. y e. Y C e. V ) $.
fvmpt2curryd.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. W ) $.
fvmpt2curryd.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. X ) $.
fvmpt2curryd.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. Y ) $.
fvmpt2curryd $p |- ( ph -> ( ( curry F ` A ) ` B ) = ( A F B ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d V x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d Y x y $.
$d ph x y $.
